entry.title: [anchor] Add CSSFlipRevertValue
entry.content:
This value behaves like CSSRevertLayerValue, except it reverts to the

value of a different property, given by the property parameter,

instead of reverting to a value for the same property like

revert-layer does. This "cross-property" revert-layer behavior

is useful for implementing "try tactics" [1] from

CSS Anchor Positioning.



CSSFlipRevertValue is entirely for internal use. There is no web-facing

change.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-anchor-position-1/#typedef-position-try-options-try-tactic



Bug: 40279608

Change-Id: Ibd037448eb88d571501ccb125d11b09e45f64941

entry.title: Get rid of float rounding when shrinking pages for printing.
entry.content:
When printing to an actual printer, a specified @page size may still be

honored by layout, but the result, if the honored page size is larger

than the paper, needs to be scaled down. There was some float rounding /

truncation involved, but this doesn't seem like a good idea in the first

place, except that one PrintRenderFrameHelperPreviewTest depended on it.

Adjust expectations instead. Expectations will still be integers, so

round all actual page layout values to the nearest integer (rather than

allowing expectations with a lot of decimals).



The motivation for this change is that I'm planning on letting Blink

take responsibility for laying out and painting the entire page box

(including the margins). This means that the shrink scaling code also

needs to be moved into Blink. However, whereas PrintRenderFrameHelper

performs the scaling on CSS pt values, Blink only knows about CSS px

values. As such, it will be impossible to truncate and round exactly as

before. So let's not do it, then.



Bug: 40281525, 40341678

Change-Id: Icfb9d4297af42e47707a68cb5888576b5a2c6e3c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349129

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1270179}

best-effort CL was constructed from a naive `git grep` to replace other

entry.title: Enables feature flag AllowWgcWindowZeroHz by default
entry.content:
This change is done as part of adding support for 0Hz screensharing

on all platforms and for all sources.



The WGC capturer has already been launched at 100% and this flag

ensures that the capturer path also supports detection of static

content which will save resources and allow us to trade this head-

room into increasing the frame rate in clients like e.g. Meet.



The added 0Hz-detection comes with a small extra cost in CPU load

but local measurements have not shown any power regressions.



Going forward; the idea is to gradually use this new feature in e.g.

Meet to allow it to capture windows on Windows at a higher rate

with a low extra cost; especially in scenarios where there is a mix

of dynamic and static content.



The flag can still be used as kill-switch if the Meet experiment

would show any signs of regressions.



Bug: 40259177

Change-Id: I7d6d5e121a2f82738e4869b7640ca9a9a976d40f

entry.title: [mullet] No manual fallback in incognito mode when no address exists
entry.content:
Address manual fallback should be shown even when users have no address

stored. We are going to prompt users to create an address if they

click on the manual fallback option.



However, it is not possible to store addresses in incognito mode.

This CL makes sure that the manual fallback option for addresses is always shown, unless the user is in incognito mode

(this is M3 flag gated).



Note that we do not have the same behaviour for payments. If an user

does not have a credit card stored, we never show the fallback option

for it.



Demo: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTY1MjQwMTcyOTA0NDQ4MHw4ZTg2ZGMzNC1lZQ



Bug: 1493361

entry.title: Add tests for invalidating all iterators
entry.content:
Add new test for the GSOC 2024 - iterator checker:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_kNdfe48YZhZol6cfN2sguSE7CqpVUwF_3VRXiKB2xo/edit#bookmark=id.ifdb6avhmtxx



Some functions invalidate all iterators of a container. But thus far, tests only have a single iterator associated with each container, meaning that the tests are not testing the cases when all iterators are supposed to be invalidated. This test checks that IteratorChecker handles this behavior correctly. This test uses std::vector::clear as the function that invalidates all iterators.

entry.title: Skip long-running tests by default
entry.content:
Tests in components/test/data/autofill/heuristics-json/internal may

take a significant time to run and should be launched with

--test-launcher-timeout 100000 on debug builds.



To ensure that they don't get accidentally executed and cause timeouts,

this CL guards them with a enw flag `--run-internal-tests`.



So the correct way to run them is via

./component_unittests \

--gtest_filter='AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/*' \

--run-internal-tests --test-launcher-timeout 100000



If `--run-internal-tests` is missing the tests are just skipped. If it

is present but `--test-launcher-timeout 100000` is missing the tests

fail with an assertion error.



Bug: 40279279

Change-Id: I6b45531a3581c74dcb3857c98a2cd7a562504fb3

entry.title: Introduce better test names for HeuristicClassificationTests
entry.content:
We used to have tests named

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/0

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/1

...



It was unclear which test referred to which file.



With this change, the input files determine the test name.



If we have files

components/test/data/autofill/heuristics-json/foo.json

components/test/data/autofill/heuristics-json/internal/bar.json

they get translated into tests

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/foo

AllForms/HeuristicClassificationTests.EndToEnd/bar



That makes it easier to execute the test you are actually interested

and/or know which input data actually failed.



Bug: 40279279

entry.title: [ios] Change "swift" tool to only list files in outputs
entry.content:
The outputs of a tool should not list directories. One reason is

that `ninja` will check the timestamp of the outputs to consider

if they have to be rebuild, but directories timestamp is rarely

updated (i.e. modifying files in the directory does not change

the timestamp, ...).



Additionally, running `gn check ...` in debug fails with check

failure in gn caused by the presence of that directory.



Instead, change the `swiftc.py` script to create a stamp file

(a simple file that is always deleted and recreated, ensuring

it always has a new timestamp) and list that file in the outputs.



Bug: 327928851, crbug.com/gn/362

Change-Id: I595a60eba1893bb660707ecd3a0d949dd534bc45

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5355732

entry.title: Update PlusAddressTable schema for sync support
entry.content:
This CL modifies PlusAddressTable in two ways:

- Since it was decided to sync down the profile_id and use it as the

storage key in sync, this should now be used as the primary key in the

database. To do so, the CL

- Adds migrating logic dropping the existing table and recreates it

with a new profile_id primary key column.

- Adds a profile_id to PlusProfile and adjusts the CRUD operations

accordingly.

- Adds migration logic adding a plus_address_sync_model_type_state and

a plus_address_sync_entity_metadata table. These will be necessary to

implement the syncer::SyncMetadataStore interface and use

PlusAddressTable as the storage layer for sync.

entry.title: [android] Set tag to sync error notifications and fix for signedin users
entry.content:
This CL relands crrev.com/c/5323083, and adds a fix for signed in users.



Notification (id,tag) pair should be unique. Somehow

(NOTIFICATION_ID_SYNC,null) pair is something that's likely getting

blocked or cancelled. Changing the id or the tag makes it work. More

investigation is required here. This CL however unblocks sync error

notifications by setting a notification tag, which is not harmful.

entry.title: [//gpu] Fix bugs in Mac Dawn SI rep's Begin/EndAccess()
entry.content:
This CL fixes two bugs in the Dawn SI rep's Begin/EndAccess():



* When returning a cached texture from BeginAccess(), we weren't setting

`texture_` to the result. This meant that EndAccess() short-circuited

out when called on a ScopedAccess for which the texture had been

cached at the beginning of the access.

* When returning early in EndAccess() due to there still being an

ongoing access to the WGPU texture, we weren't setting `texture_` to

nullptr. This meant that a second EndAccess() on the same

representation would incorrectly *not* short-circuit out at the

beginning and instead again decrement the number of ongoing accesses

to the texture. This could lead it to incorrectly conclude that there

were no ongoing accesses to the texture and invoke

SharedTextureMemory::EndAccess(). Notably, the Dawn representation

calls EndAccess() on its destruction, relying on EndAccess() being

idempotent.



The second bug manifested itself as a compositor problem when enabling

SupportsMultipleConcurrentReadAccesses() for this representation:



* An ImageContextImpl creates a Dawn representation and scoped access.

* A second ImageContextImpl creates a Dawn representation and scoped

access on the same backing, resulting in the cached wgpu::Texture

being reused.

* Submit is done for work referencing the first ImageContextImpl,

and it is subsequently released and destroys its scoped access and

representation. This results in SharedTextureMemory::EndAccess()

being called on the texture.

* Submit is done for work referencing the second ImageContextImpl.

Dawn validation fails because the wgpu::Texture is no longer

holding an access.



Existing IOSurfaceImageBacking unittests of caching didn't surface

this issue due to the first bug masking the second bug. This CL

fixes both bugs and additionally adds a unittest that fails unless

both bugs are fixed (of note, the existing unittests also surface

the second bug once the first bug is fixed). The unittest aims to

mimic the compositor flow described above.



Bug: 41496467

Change-Id: I1689d5f96634b0a1dd9bbece436eb9943da3dc93

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5352966

Reviewed-by: Austin Eng

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Reviewed-by: Sunny Sachanandani

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1270099}

entry.title: Remove kMaybe* values from WebExposedIsolationLevel
entry.content:
The WebExposedIsolationLevel is set in SiteInfo with potential values

KNonIsolated, kMaybeIsolated and kMaybeIsolatedApplication. The

latter two are always converted to kIsolated and kIsolatedApplication when

passed to the content/ embedder. It does not make sense to keep the

kMaybe* values as there is no place in the code that differentiates

between kMaybeIsolated and kIsolated or kMaybeIsolatedApplication and

kIsolatedApplication.

entry.title: trusted_vault: Instantiate RecoveryKeyStoreController
entry.content:
This allows StandaloneTrustedVaultBackend to optionally own a

RecoveryKeyStoreController to enable periodic recovery key store

uploads. To enable uploads, a RecoveryKeyProvider must be passed in at construction time, and the `SetRecoveryKeyStoreUploadsEnabled()`

instance method must be called. The backend keeps track of the enabled

state and the last successful upload timestamp via the on-disk

LocalTrustedVault state.

entry.title: [anchor] Use designated initializers to test CascadePriority
entry.content:
The current flat list of arguments makes hard to understand what

they mean, e.g. "author, true, 0, false, false, 0, 0". It also

makes it cumbersome to make changes to CascadePriority, because

there are so many call sites (of the constructor) that require

adjustment.



We can use designated initializers in order to automatically get

a reasonable default for all these call sites whenever we add

something new.



There is no behavior change.



Bug: 40279608

entry.title: PA: Prefer just "PartitionAlloc"
entry.content:
Common parlance has favored "PartitionAlloc" for quite a while now. This

best-effort CL was constructed from a naive `git grep` to replace other

spellings (e.g. "partition alloc," "Partition Alloc," "partition

allocator," etc.) with the most common one.



This change was created with `git cl split` and is scoped to

/build_overrides.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=hans@chromium.org



Change-Id: I1c82c7e3586c4eff844083111f729ec9741cbdd3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5355407

Auto-Submit: Kalvin Lee

Reviewed-by: Hans Wennborg

Commit-Queue: Hans Wennborg

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1270074}

entry.title: [remoting host] Add protobuf ErrorCode plus refactoring
entry.content:
* Add an `ErrorCode` definition to Chromium code base, so that it can

be used for corp logging.

* Move `protocol::ErrorCode` to base/ since it is being used in many

different places.

* Turn `protocol::ErrorCode` into an enum class, since otherwise its

value would pollute the `remoting` namespace.

* Fix existing call sites that do not treat `ErrorCode` as an enum

class.

* Create aliases of the non-protocol ErrorCode in protocol/ to keep

existing usages happy.

* Move `name_value_map` into its own target, since it was in `base`

which depends on proto:internal_structs, so internal_structs

couldn't depend on it due to dependency cycle.



Bug: b/328138087

Change-Id: I55cc8f5fcdf242007d783b888fcdf2b46933cc5d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349388

Reviewed-by: Jeroen Dhollander

Commit-Queue: Yuwei Huang

Auto-Submit: Yuwei Huang

Reviewed-by: Joe Downing

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1270073}

entry.title: Separate TabSharingInfoBar independent of ConfirmInfoBar
entry.content:
The tab-sharing infobar has diverged from the ConfirmInfoBar to such

an extent that reusing the ConfirmInfoBar implementation is no longer

of help, but more of a hindrance.



In this CL a new TabSharingInfoBar is introduced and the

TabSharingInfoBarDelegate is made to inherit directly from the

InfoBarDelegate instead of from the ConfirmInfoBarDelegate.



The API between TabSharingInfoBar and the TabSharingInfoBarDelegate

will be adapted to more directly support the tab-sharing infobar

usecase in follow-up CLs.



Bug: 327501794

Change-Id: I8b0b44b2bfda82ce110a72ed08ea3ef8c59d6a3c

entry.title: Reduce run_all_fuzzers.py disk usage
entry.content:
This script is used to gather fuzzing code coverage.

Under some circumstances this script runs the fuzzer individually

over each test case. Previously, each such run made a .profraw file

of potentially hundreds of MB. Given hundreds or thousands of

test cases, that has the potential to fill the bot disk.



With this change, we merge the profraw file into an accumulating profdata file after each test case is run, so there's no need

to maintain a per-test-case profraw file.



This may make the job take significantly longer, but should

eliminate failures due to lack of disk space.



Bug: 326493647

Change-Id: Iaa1bd82a010e6dd354e9eb7fa998c4b75a8e5ef4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323343

Commit-Queue: Adrian Taylor

Reviewed-by: Paul Semel

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1270057}

entry.title: [Reland 1] lens: Add a close button to the overlay.
entry.content:
The initial CL caused the feature tests to fail because the feature was

enabled in the field trial test config, but not by the test itself. This

meant that configurations which skipped the field trial test config

would not pass the test.



This CL explicitly enables the feature in the relevant tests.



> This CL makes several small changes:

>

> (1) Fixes some mistakes in the plumbing for the lens overlay WebUI.

>

> (2) Adds a close button to the overlay, adds a close method to the

> mojom, and hooks them together.

>

> (3) Creates a mechanism to uniquely tie together the WebUIController and

> the LensOverlayController.

>

> (4) Removes LensPageHandler, as LensOverlayController now directly

> communicates with the WebUI.

>

> Bug: 328088153

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5351243

entry.title: [inert] The modal dialog and the fullscreen element should escape inertness of ancestor
entry.content:
According to the spec:

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#modal-dialogs-and-inert-subtrees

> While document is so blocked, every node that is connected to

> document, with the exception of the subject element and its flat tree

> descendants, must become inert. subject can additionally become inert

> via the inert attribute, but only if specified on subject itself

> (i.e., subject escapes inertness of ancestors); subject's flat tree

> descendants can become inert in a similar fashion.



The modal dialog should escape the inertness set by an ancestor

with the inert attribute. Consider this test case:



find me!







The return value of `window.find('me')` should be true,

because `` does not specify the inert attribute.



Bug: 328339024

Change-Id: Ib6d0aa00d63740b4e13457c38e4602a595bb26ba

entry.title: Refactor: Remove unnecessary condition from set_lcp_element_locators
entry.content:
This CL removes an unnecessary condition from

set_lcp_element_locators. Currently, set_lcp_element_locators() is only

called from WebLocalFrameImpl::SetLCPPHint(). And SetLCPPHint() always

calls lcpp->Reset() before calling lcpp->set_lcp_element_locators(). So

no need to have this condition anymore.

entry.title: PA: Prefer just "PartitionAlloc"
entry.content:
Common parlance has favored "PartitionAlloc" for quite a while now. This

best-effort CL was constructed from a naive `git grep` to replace other

spellings (e.g. "partition alloc," "Partition Alloc," "partition

allocator," etc.) with the most common one.



This change was created with `git cl split` and is scoped to

/third_party/blink/renderer/controller.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: App launching should not rely on GetLastActive() for app browser.
entry.content:
LaunchAppWithCallback() launches an app and passes the app browser

to the callback function. However, it replies on

BrowserList::GetInstance()->GetLastActive() to return the app

browser, which is not reliable. The last active browser is not

guaranteed to be the app browser associated with the app being

launched. In Lacros case, the update of the last active browser

could be done asynchronously, and GetLastActive could return

a wrong browser to be passed to the callback function.



This cl fixes this issue by finding the app_browser in a reliable

approach.



Bug: 325634285

Change-Id: I2b14b47525e566cc366b49ea283391e16b125752

entry.title: Remove ignore_bounds_change_request_
entry.content:
This was introduced many years ago on crrev.com/c/1578719 so

we can skip UpdatePipBounds() between window state change into

PiP and initial bounds change for PiP.



This approach was taken at that time because there was no way to

tell whether initial bounds is already set when UpdatePipBounds()

is called, but now we set PiP snap fraction once the initial

bounds is set in exo, so we can handle this in ash.

entry.title: [mojo] Use large worker for mojom_parser action
entry.content:
Remote mojom_parser actions often fail for OOM.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/build/build-perf-android-siso/1241/overview

It's also better to use a large worker (8 cores) to speed up

mojom_parse, which utilizes multi cores.



This CL introduces `remote_worker=large` option to `action`

template to switch the rewrapper cfgs.

entry.content:
crrev.com/c/758962 introduced BrokerProcessPreSandboxHook() in

content/gpu/gpu_sandbox_hook_linux.cc because

comment in BrokerProcessPreSandboxHook() make an excuse.

entry.content:
This reverts commit 78df15491c5917c9c9fda6d2fce2710782f88931.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5631028402061312

> Tick keyboard and scripted smooth scrolls on the compositor thread.

> smooth scrolls that are initiated from main.

> WebPagePopup is still a special case that needs to tick on main (see

> crbug.com/1503709 and crbug.com/1270173).

entry.title: [a11y]: provide [un]register event methods for AXEventGenerator
entry.content:
This change introduces the idea of event registration into

AXEventGenerator.



For a given event, AXEventGenerator needs to compute the diff of old and

new node data, and potentially fire events on one or more nodes.



In the case of related nodes changed, the number of events fired may be

substantial.



With event registration:

- events targeted on a node with no node/ancestor registrants for that

event will skip

- if no nodes are registered for a given event, it can be skipped



We currently start off with related nodes changed, but this can be

expanded to other events.



Bug: none

Test: cq

Change-Id: Id486b64a6de5350afcacb6e5aa678d0831351c37

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5354226

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

Commit-Queue: David Tseng

entry.title: wayland: disable eye dropper blink feature till it's properly supported
entry.content:
Aura implementation of EyeDropperView [1] does not work well with the

Wayland Ozone backend. Instead, a separate implementation backed by XDG

Desktop Portal's Screenshot.PickColor API [2] will probably be required.

Which is conceptually similar to EyeDropperLacros impl [3].



On Gnome Shell 45, for example, trying to use eye dropper result in the

whole browser crashing with a seg fault. Thus, as a short-term fix, this

hook into chrome's feature list setup process such that ozone backend

code is able to override features which reflect at renderer side by

disabling unsupported/broken features, such as EyeDropper dialogs in

this case.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/eye_dropper/eye_dropper_view.cc

[2] https://docs.flatpak.org/en/latest/portal-api-reference.html#gdbus-org.freedesktop.impl.portal.Screenshot

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/eye_dropper/eye_dropper_lacros.cc



Bug: 40800718

Test: Manually with https://captainbrosset.github.io/eyedropper-demos/photo-color-swap.html

Change-Id: I0e182ab4119de0e11b4cfaee00dc891f4df5c8aa

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5328412

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Commit-Queue: Nick Yamane

Reviewed-by: Stephen Chenney

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269993}

entry.title: Revert "[iOS][Waffle] Fix EGTest for search engine dialog"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 2cad1ef4618133dc45816fc0fa72ab983d00b6b9.



Reason for revert: tests are flaky



first build:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ios-simulator-noncq/42627/overview



Original change's description:

> [iOS][Waffle] Fix EGTest for search engine dialog

>

> This patch updates `[SettingsAppInterface resetSearchEngine]` to

> clear kDefaultSearchProviderChoiceScreenCompletionTimestamp pref.

>

> To make FirstRunWithSearchEngineChoiceTestCase tests more reliable,

> `[SettingsAppInterface resetSearchEngine]` is called in the setUp

> and the tearDown. This is to make sure those tests won't fail and

> to clean up after the tests.

>

> Same principal about setUp and tearDown is applied to

> `SearchEngineTestCase`.

> Therefore those EGTests can be enabled:

> SearchEngineTestCase/testOpenSecondWindow

> SearchEngineTestCase/testSearchEngineChoiceScreenSelectThenScroll

> SearchEngineTestCase/testSearchEngineChoiceScreenScrollThenSelect

>

entry.title: Exo: Calculate output and damage rect only from effective area
entry.content:
This CL introduces visual_rect_ in exo::Surface and use it to get the

output rect and damage rect so that we no longer include clipped area to

the host window and other rect.



This should not change the behavior, but expect to improve the

performance.



Bug: b:310104911
